title.narrative: DRC COVID-19 Global Appeal Europe Region

description.narrative:
DRC is present in 7 countries in the Europe Region along with Denmark where DRC Headquarters is located. DRC has implemented COVID-19 specific activities in four of them: Bosnia & Herzegovina, Denmark, Kosovo & Ukraine .

WASH & Protection are the sectors with the highest amount of targeted people in this region.

• Health assistance: Ensure that vulnerable communities have equitable access to quality health care information and services, including use of mobile units and telemedicine. DRC also aims to provide essential medical equipment, supplies and Personal Protective Equipment to public healthcare facilities and health actors.

• Protection, Social Work, Legal Aid: Immediate focus on vulnerable groups such as Unaccompanied and Separated Children (UASC), individuals exposed to domestic violence and Gender Based Violence, stateless people and communities.

• Education and learning: Support to families with children at home, including toys and learning material, learning material to refugee centres and on-line support to school-work for refugee children.

• Community Engagement and Information Dissemination: Strengthen the provision of information to ensure awareness of the COVID-19 risks, including through website in 25 languages, 24h helpdesks and hotlines, dissemination of information in asylum centres and through outreach units.

• Basic Need Assistance: Food, Cash, critical Non Food Items (NFI) for refugees, migrants and affected communities living in destitution or isolation.

• Economic Recovery: Promote community welfare with a view to inclusion and cohesion, through interventions aimed at reducing poverty and social fragility; activate support to micro, small and medium enterprises that have substantially lost revenue and face layoffs.

• Water, Sanitation, Hygiene: Perform repairs and essential maintenance to water systems in affected communities. Distribute hygiene materials for hand washing/disinfection and scale-up hygiene promotion activities.

In Bosnia & Herzegovina , DRC has focused on assisting asylum seekers, refugees and migrants who are accommodated and residing in reception centers, as well as those lacking access to shelter. Through DRC outreach teams maintained access to primary health services have been ensured - such as screening, assisting reporting on persons exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms and facilitation of the testing process while ensuring adequate referral.

In Ukraine , DRC has provided information provision, counseling, documentation, administrative assistance and in-court support to conflict-affected people . DRC has also provided basic needs assistance in the form of cash assistance to families who lost their daily income as a result of COVID-19 restrictions.

In Kosovo , DRC assisted IDPs in collective centers as well as marginalized communities and returnees who were considered the most vulnerable groups impacted by COVID-19. Priorities targeted included food assistance and other basic needs support

In Denmark , DRC continued counselling sessions with refugees, asylum seekers, and migrants remotely while direct meetings were not possible. Acknowledging the specific information needs of these vulnerable groups DRC operated a website and hotline about COVID-19 in 25 languages and provided remote learning support for children at times when schools were closed.

DRC has received new funding from donors for it's COVID-19 response. At the same time, many donors have permitted us to re-programme existing grants for our COVID-19 specific work. While for now we are only reporting the financial volume of the new COVID-19 specific grants, we will also report on our re-programmed funds as soon as this information becomes available to us.

The OECD DAC CRS Purpose Codes used to describe this activity refers to the amount of people reached, seen as a percentage of all single instances of beneficiaries reached. This means that it can include double counting, if single individuals have been counted multiple times for different sectors.
